snippet: With no coordinated national approach to fighting elder abuse, “the social workers and others who are trying to help are forced to invent the wheel over and over,” Marie-Therese Connolly said.
abstract: Former Justice Department prosecutor Marie-Therese Connolly is fighting to raise awareness of elder abuse, including highlighting the costs to society of financial, physical and psychological mistreatment of older adults; grant from the MacArthur Foundation has recognized her efforts, giving her the financial freedom to re-frame the issue on her own terms.
lead_paragraph: With no coordinated national approach to fighting elder abuse, “the social workers and others who are trying to help are forced to invent the wheel over and over,” Marie-Therese Connolly said.

headline.seo: Lawyer to Chronicle People Who Fight Abuse of Elderly
headline.main: A Prosecutor Becomes a Champion for the Elderly
headline.print_headline: A Prosecutor Becomes a Champion for the Elderly
